character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man does not normally demonstrate much skill when attacking an enemy fleet.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of defeat after starting at least one naval attack.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be removed if the admiral is victorious when he attacks a fleet.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: It would be better for everyone concerned if this man stayed locked in his cabin during any kind of naval attack.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of defeat after commencing several naval attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be removed if the admiral is repeatedly victorious when he attacks enemy fleets.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A confused flatfish shows more aggression and skill than this admiral when attacking.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of defeat in a great many naval attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This failing is a permanent stain on this admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral shows the skill to use his aggressive instincts to good advantage in battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained through victory in at least one naval attack.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait might be lost if the admiral is defeated when he attacks a fleet.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral has a talent for attacking and using the prevailing conditions to gain the advantage.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained through victory in several naval attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait could be lost if the admiral is repeatedly beaten when he attacks a fleet.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral is a master of aggressive fleet actions, and almost swoons with the desire to attack!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained through victory in a great many naval attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This exceptional trait cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a clear grasp of naval tactics, and the controlled aggression to use them to brilliant effect.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained through victory in many outstanding naval attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This exceptional trait cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: With the wind at his back, no enemy fleet in the world can hold this national hero in check!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained through victory in many outstanding naval attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This exceptional trait cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man finds command of a rowing boat something of a trial.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of losing at least one sea battle.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Victory in a battle at sea should wipe away this character stain.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Perhaps it is seasickness, but this man shows a little ineptitude when fighting at sea.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has lost several sea battles, and his lack of skill is now obvious.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Repeated victory in sea battles will probably remove this character flaw.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The handling of ships in battle is a talent that has so far eluded this admiral.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of many defeats at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Repeated and consistent success in sea battles should remove this trait.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A man so conspicuously hopeless in command might be better employed feeding fish - as bait.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Many terrible and embarrassing defeats have caused this character trait.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This flaw is a permanent feature of this admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is a danger to his bath sponge, let alone any hapless sailors under his command.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This inability is the result of losing many significant naval battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This admiral can never lose this stain on his character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This fellow displays strong command of the light, fast ships needed to break through a blockade of ships.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has successfully broken an enemy blockade.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can be lost by a defeat whilst attempting to break a blockade.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This fellow has shown remarkable skill and aplomb whilst smashing through enemy naval blockades.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has successfully broken several enemy blockades.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can only be lost by several defeats whilst attempting to break blockades.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This fellow confounds the enemy with the elusive speed and manoeuvrability of his expertly-controlled ships.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has successfully broken many enemy blockades.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot now be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: An admiral can employ techniques to prevent enemy ships breaking his blockade. This fellow knows many of them.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has successfully upheld a blockade against enemy attack.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can be lost if the enemy breaks his blockade.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Due to his skill when blockading enemy ports, only a master blockade runner stands a chance against this man.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has successfully upheld several blockades against enemy attack.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can be lost if the enemy breaks several blockades.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: No one gets past this man, his line of ships is like a wall of steel to an enemy fleet.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has successfully upheld many blockades against enemy attack.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot now be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man may have heard of the art of public speaking, but he certainly doesn't believe it worth learning.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Lack of confidence and defeat have made this man a poor speaker.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Winning a battle or two would go a long way to giving this man the confidence to speak well.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man can inspire people to hurl themselves into the sea, mostly to get away from his awful rhetoric.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Many defeats have eaten away at this man's public persona.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will always be a damn tedious speechmaker.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The sea is this man's first love, a good fight his second!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Good fortune smiled on this man from birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This is a permanent feature of the man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man can read the wind and waves, so gaining an advantage in battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Good fortune smiled on this man from birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This is a permanent feature of the man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: An innate understanding of the sea's moods give this man an advantage in any battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Good fortune smiled on this man from birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This is a permanent feature of the man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A steadying presence on the quarterdeck does much to make the men feel better.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has shown no hestitation when personally involved in close combat.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Running from a fight will probably remove this admiral's reputation for bravery.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral laughs in the face of danger. Although he is obviously barking mad, his men love him for it.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has been personally involved in close-quarter fighting on more than one occasion.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Repeatedly running from a fight will probably damage this admiral's reputation as a brave man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "The enemy, sir? Time's better spent in fearing kelp, barnacles, herring and... Andâ€¦my mother!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has often engaged in close-quarter fighting.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Courage is now a fixture of the admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's name is a byword for courage throughout the fleet, and throughout the land fathers name their newborn sons after him!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has rarely scorned the opportunity to come to grips with his foes in close-quarter battle!
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Courage is now a fixture of the admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "Courage" might as well be this man's middle name. Children, ships and city streets - along with houses of ill-repute and drinking dens - are named in his honour.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral almost always grasps the opportunity to come to grips with his foes in close-quarter battle!
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Courage is now a fixture of the admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is more at home aboard ship than on his native soil.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was born a proud British son of the sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot lose his birthright as a sailor.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Sent to sea almost as soon as he could walk, this man knows winds and tides as friends.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: From birth, this man had a taste for a life aboard ship.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot lose his inheritance as a seafarer.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The siren song of the sea! Is there any other tune worth listening to for a true Briton?
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was marked for the sea from the moment he drew his first breath.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man was born a sailor, and will probably die a sailor.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: When this man is discussed in polite society his tailor attracts more praise than his courage.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has panicked and routed at least once in the presence of the enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Victory in battle may well wipe away the suspicion of cowardice in this fellow.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Rumours of this man's cowardice are quietly whispered - at least where he can hear them.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has often panicked in the presence of the enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Many victories will probably be required to wipe away the taint of cowardice.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral's cowardice is the subject of much bitter humour on the lower decks.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has persistently panicked when in the presence of an enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Cowardice is now a permanent feature of this admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Cowardice is an ugly word, but it is the only one that will do.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has persistently and publicly panicked when in the presence of an enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Cowardice is now a permanent feature of this admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a talent for commanding smaller ships, and using them to advantage.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Victory while commanding a frigate-class vessel has given this man some skill.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Defeat in battle may cause the loss of this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a talent for running smaller ships, and making a profit into the bargain!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has gained his skills in many battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: The skill of commanding frigates will never be lost, although it may be improved.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man relishes the independence of smaller commands, and uses unrated ships to their full potential.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man's understanding has been gained over the course of his career as a commander in battle.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This admiral cannot lose his skill at commanding cruisers.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Naval combat when on the strategic defensive is not one of this man's strengths.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of at least one defeat after suffering a naval attack.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be removed if the admiral is victorious when he is attacked.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral has comprehensively failed to understand how to fight a fleet when he is attacked.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of repreated defeats after being attacked at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be removed if the admiral is repeatedly victorious when he is attacked.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: There are ducks that have a better grasp of defensive naval tactics than this admiral.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of defeat in a great many naval attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This failing is a permanent stain on the admiral's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a good grasp of fleet handling when on the strategic defensive.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained as a result of victory when attacked at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if the admiral is defeated when he is attacked.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral displays much skill when attacked and can find an advantage in wind and wave even when on the defensive.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained as a result of many victories when attacked at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if the admiral is beaten repeatedly when he is attacked.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has an almost-unmatched grasp of defensive naval tactics, and is rarely bested when attacked.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained as a result of glorious victories when attacked at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This exceptional trait cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: When attacked, this admiral's handling of any fleet action is decisive, masterly - and usually victorious!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained as a result of many glorious victories when attacked at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This exceptional trait cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's wine merchant is comfortably wealthy.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Lack of employment has given this man a chance to drink.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Orders for this admiral that keep him from being bored might help him discover sobriety.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has an awesome capacity for strong drink with every meal, and between meals too.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: With too much time on his hands, the bits in between the drinking no longer interest this man.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A long period of active campaigning should help this admiral regain control over his prodigious thirst.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "A rum ration, sir? Bring me a bucket, and less of your insolence!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Unmanaged and now unmanageable, abusive drunkeness holds full dominion over this fellow.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unfortunate trait cannot now be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Strong spirits have entirely ruined this man: his mind is broken and his fortune is pissed away.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Incapable of earning a wage even if he could remember where the ship was, drinking is now his sole occupation.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will carry the burden of his drinking to his grave.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man could find his way through any shoal waters or weather any storm, and never even spill his gin!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was born within sight of the sea, and the salt tang is his earliest memory.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: He was born with this talent, and it will be his forever.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has an inherent air of command that gives confidence to his underlings.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was almost born with a compass clutched in his hand.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot lose his taste for the sea.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The sea and its ways hold no mysteries for this man, and he fears nothing when afloat.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was born to the sea, and is truly at home there.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This maritime skill can never be taken from this man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a good grasp of naval tactics.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has won at least one sea battle, and has gained some skill as a result.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if this admiral is defeated in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man understands the business of sinking enemy ships.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Repeated victory at sea has improved this man's command skills.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost through repeated defeats in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has the talent to win sea battles, and has developed the habit of doing so.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of many victories at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Even the wind and waves seem to obey this man's commands, such is his mastery of naval combat.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has gained this trait because he has won a series of significant naval battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Sailors under this man's command willingly set course for Hell, confident that he will bring them glory and prize money in equal measure!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has won many great and glorious sea battles, and probably changed history by his actions!
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This outstanding command skill cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Mockery is heaped upon this officer's efforts.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: A major defeat at sea brings extra opprobrium upon the unfortunate commander.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These slurs can be countered by victory in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is seldom praised, often vilified, and given to kicking hacks into the sea.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: More than one defeat has made this man the target of press mockery.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: The contempt of the press can be eased by victories.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "He also has a rather unsatisfying 'smallholding', at, ahem, 'Breeches Manor', or so I'm toldâ€¦"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Several major defeats have made the press blame this man for all his service's ills.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: No matter what naval success this man enjoys, his reputation as a fool is now secure.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The scales! The eyes! Fish know things: secrets from the deep mere men were never meant to fathom.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man is badly in need of shore-leave before he takes leave of his senses completely.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man needs orders to follow, not time to think.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "It's a very nice colour scheme for the fleet. I think it sits well with the swivel gun napkins."
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Long years at sea have taken their toll on this man's mind.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man needs to be kept very busy for many years in order to correct his quirks.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Facing the Fish of Fear has left this man a tragic, broken figure, but one with a prodigious taste for leeks.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Too much time at sea without hope of rest has damaged this man's psyche.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This sad delusion is now a permanent part of this man's mind.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "The judicious lash, Sir, corrects neglect of duty, and consequently saves many a ship and fleet."
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has trained a few crews for service at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can be lost through inaction.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "I'll have discipline and bravery at all times, or the ingrate whelps will have the lash!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has long experience of crewing ships: taking landsmen and turning them into sailors.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will never change his attitude.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "Rum: a fair ration. Sodomy: never, Sir, and damn your eyes. And the lash: Pah! I am positively liberal with the lash!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has long experience of crewing ships and keeping them at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will be known as a tyrant to his dying day.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Being good with numbers increases the efficiency of fleet administration, keeping upkeep to a minimum.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has an inherent gift for numbers.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot be lost, only improved.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has the clarity of thought to manage both his costs and navigational calculations to a greater degree than most.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has an inherent gift for numbers.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This officer's actions are reported on with approval, possibly because he writes his own despatches.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Victory in an important sea battle or two has brought fame to this man.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These good reports can soon be overturned by failure in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral is written about with admiration by hacks, pamphleteers and other low fellows.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Repeated major victories have brought notoriety to this man.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Several defeats at sea could cause the gutter press to turn against this man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Newspaper editions are considered incomplete if they do not include praise of this officer.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Victories almost without number are attributed to this man, or his good offices.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: No matter how foolish or inept in battle, this man need not worry that the press will turn against him.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a real talent for using a ship of the line to the full.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Victory in battle while commanding ships of the line has given this man some skills.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This skill may be lost by defeat in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is an expert in the handling of ships of the line.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Many victories in command of ships of the line has given this man his skills.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: The skill of command cannot be lost, only improved with practice.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is truly at home in those majestic castles of the sea, battle ships!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Famous victories as a battle fleet commander have given this man his understanding.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This admiral cannot lose his skill at commanding ships of the line.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This admiral shows much consideration - too much - for the feelings of the lower decks.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral is not noted for his strenous attention to duty while on campaign.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A few hard sea battles may make this man understand discipline, and change his kindly ways.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A kind heart is a worthy thing, in a maiden aunt or chaplain. Finding it on the quarterdeck is another matter.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This admiral has, over many years, perfected the art of not doing very much.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Active servce in many battles may harden this man's heart where discipline is concerned.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's public distaste for correct, if harsh, discipline is now prejudicial to the navy.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man is an expert at doing as little as possible while on campaign.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unfortunate weakness is now too entrenched to be changed.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This fellow does not drink, and doesn't think anyone else should either.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man abstains from alcohol because he doesn't like the taste.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait cannot be removed, only increased.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Refusing to accept the intrinsic relationship between sailors and their grog, he scowls at any who call for the bottle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man abstains from alcohol for moral reasons.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait cannot be removed, only increased.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: He brings everyone down with his dour and joyless manner, leaving little respite from the rigours of naval life.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man abstains because he dislikes any loss of self control.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait cannot be removed.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Honour is this man's watchword, almost his catechism.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man learned the meaning of honour as a child.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot set his honour or nationality aside.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: For this man, to be a Spaniard is to be honourable, no matter what the cost. If that is death, then so be it.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man's family are the source of his sense of honour and duty.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Lesser men may change their beliefs, but not this man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's heart swells with pride when he thinks of his precious homeland. He is nothing without the honour of service to the land.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was born proud. That is immensely satisfying.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will never deny his Spanish birthright, because it defines him as a man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has spirit, bravado - a touch of "derring-do". Bravely leading the men in boarding actions, he isn't afraid to get his hands dirty.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has personally fought the enemy hand-to-hand during a boarding action.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait cannot be removed.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a talent for listening to local gossip, and for spotting those who are not local.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent a little time in one place, and has gained some insight into the locality.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This local knowledge relies on the man remaining local and not moving away.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man can smell out a stranger in his area, particularly one with designs against his nation.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent time in the locality, and can now feel when something is amiss.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability to spot what is out of place will be lost if the man moves.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has many friends, and is quite willing to listen to their opinions of foreigners and strangers.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent a long time in the area, and is a trusted man.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This force of informers will be dispersed if the man is forced to move.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's suspicious nature is backed by a prodigious memory for information, useful abilities for anyone who hunts spies.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man spent years in the same place, and knows nearly everything that is going on.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man's hold over local affairs will be fatally weakened if he is forced to move.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has notes on everyone in the area, and is not above threatening people with exposure of their little "weaknesses".
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent many years in the locality and knows everyone's secrets as a result.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This understanding of the locality will be lost if the man moves.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a talent for listening to local gossip, picking out of the nuggets of golden truth in the process.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: A short time spent settling down has given this man his contacts.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This local knowledge will be lost if the spy moves.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man knows many people, and listens to their concerns - and whatever else they let slip.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These contacts can be improved if the spy remains in his current location.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These local contacts rely on the spy remaining in the same place. Any move could break them.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has assiduously made friends in the bureaucracy, and knows how to listen to their woes - and secrets.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent time doing nothing but make friends.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: If the spy moves, these connections to government will be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has made a point of setting a good table, and of listening to his important guests as they gossip.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent a long time doing little but make friends.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These friends will find a new companion if the spy moves.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has made a point of being kind to servants. After all, they know all the secrets of their masters...
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent many years doing nothing but talking with people of all stations in society.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These connections are fragile, and will be broken if the spy moves.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has spun a web of deception about himself and, like any spider, knows when there is a fly, or a secret, nearby.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has dedicated many years of effort to cultivating his informers.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This delicate web of informers will be destroyed if this spymaster is forced to move.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Convention and morality do not trouble this man, except when it comes to spelling them.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: With too little to occupy this man, it is no wonder that his thoughts have become unsavoury.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Time spent profitably away from the pleasures of the flesh would do much to change this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "Me? Help a milkmaid carry her jugs? With my reputation?"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has spent too long without profitable employment.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A long time spent away from the fleshpots might ameliorate this unfortunate failing.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man delights in meretricious company, relishing even the loss of reputation.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has had too little to do, and fallen in with the wrong kind of fellows.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: It will take years of self-denial and hard work to improve this man's sad lack of manners and character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: To ease his filthy ways, this man has ordered his tailor to alter - most unpleasantly, let it be noted - his breeches.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Many years spent without decent company and proper employment have pushed this man along a path of vice.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man's lewdness can no longer be cured, only endured by his acquaintances.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: No foul act is beyond this man's pleasurable contemplation and practice. His servants walk in fear.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Too many years without sensible, honest work have made this man what he is: disgusting.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man can no longer help himself: his behaviour would shame a bawd.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's conduct is so base and depraved that no gentleman would want to comprehend his foulness.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: A lifetime of filth, only briefly interrupted by work, have made this man into a fiend.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A disgusting reputation as a predatory womaniser will follow this fellow to his grave.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Why fight fairly when advantage can be gained by cunning and stealth?
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of victory during at least one ambush.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This skill may be lost if the general is defeated in an ambush battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A thief unhanged? A common brigand? Or a military man with a talent for the unexpected?
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of victory in several ambushes.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if the general is defeated in a few ambush battles.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Stratagems and trickery are legitimate parts of the soldier's craft, and this man excels in their use.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of victory in many ambush battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This useful skill cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The banditry of ungentlemanly ambushes is not to this man's taste.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of defeat in at least one ambush.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unfortunate failing may vanish if the general wins at least one victory in an ambush battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general will not have any soldiers indulging in ungentlemanly sneaking about. And quite right too!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of being defeated in several ambushes.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if the general wins repeated victories in ambush battles.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Underhand conduct and treacherous tricks - such as ambushes - are decidedly not in this general's mental armoury.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of a great many defeats in ambush battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This strategic failing is a permanent feature of this general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This gentleman does not like fighting in the backwoods of the unwashed and uncivilized colonies.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of repeated defeats in North America.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost by repeated victories in North America.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has developed something of a blind spot where woods, trees and Americans are concerned.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This tactical failing is a result of many defeats in North American battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This tactical weakness is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has learned to make use of the rugged terrain of North America.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained through victorious battles in North America.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost by losing battles fought in North America.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a superior grasp of the brutal business of fighting in the American hinterland.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This skill has been gained after many victories in North America.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This skill is now a permanent part of this man's intellectual armoury.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Attacking and starting a battle are not this general's greatest strengths.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of defeat after mounting an attack on an enemy army.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability can probably be lost by gaining victory while attacking in the field.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general shows a distinct lack of talent when leading an attack.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of many failed field attacks on enemy armies.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability may be lost by repeatedly gaining victory when attacking in the field.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Attacking an enemy army is one art that this man has never mastered - and the troops know it.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the "prize" for a great many failed attacks against enemy armies in the field.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This general cannot have his weakness in attack removed. Ever.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a deserved reputation for being skilled when ordering an attack.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained by successfully attacking enemy armies.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability may be lost if the general is defeated when attacking.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's aggressive ways are translated into tactical excellence!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained by repeated success when attacking enemy armies.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability may be lost if the general is repeatedly defeated when attacking.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is an extremely aggressive and skilful attacker, and with good reason.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of successful and mighty attacks on enemy armies in the field.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This strength is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Few generals reach such a pinnacle of expertise, and can organise and lead attacks with the facility shown by this man.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of many huge and successful attacks on enemy armies in the field.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This strength is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general is a master of the attack; his opponents are crushed by his skilled management of fire and movement.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of many earth-shaking attacks on enemy armies in the field.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This strength is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A childhood listening to his elders and betters has given this man a solid understanding of Ottoman villainy.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man learned prejudice early in life.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: No true Austrian would seek to change such a quirk of character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man took in hatred for the heathen Turks along with his mother's milk.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man's hatreds are as much a part of him as his love of his homeland.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man has no wish or ability to change his good Austrian character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man learned the art of hating Turks at his father's knee. His has honed his skills since then.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Taught to hate, this man is a product of his birth and education.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man would no more dream of changing his ways than he would of serving the Ottomans.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man thinks he understands the business of war. He does not.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has been defeated at least once, and his command in battle is suffering as a result.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This character flaw may be erased by victory in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Command of men in battle is a missing aspect of this man's character.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has been beaten more than once in battle. He is not a confident commander as a result.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This character flaw can probably be erased by repeated victory in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man should not give orders to parlour maids, let alone soldiers!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has suffered many defeats, and his belief in his own skills has suffered.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This character flaw may be erased by many victories in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is truly dangerous on the field of battle mostly, it must be said, to his own men!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man is no stranger to defeat, and his lack of command ability is a clear reflection of that.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unfortunate flaw is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Few men reach such depths of military incompetence and live to tell the tale.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been caused by many great and terrible defeats in battle.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This disastrous lack of ability is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: What's a few casualties between friends? This man believes that in order to get results you have to get stuck in.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has achieved victory, but lost a few men in the process.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can be removed via some less costly victories.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The win is the thing, does it really matter if a few degenerate ingrates get sacrificed along the way?
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: He has won a few battles, but his casualty-rate is exceptionally high.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can be removed via several less-costly victories.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The day hasn't gone well unless there's blood. Everywhere. Preferably the enemy's of course, but he's not picky.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This fellow has won many battles, but his casualty-rate is astronomical.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait can be removed via many economical victories.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Warfare is this man's calling. His heart thrills at the trumpet's note!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Good fortune smiled on this man from birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This is a permanent feature of the man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a splendid aptitude for war, as his enemies will discover!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Good fortune smiled on this man from birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This is a permanent feature of the man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man was born not with a silver spoon in his mouth, but a sabre in his fist!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Good fortune smiled on this man from birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This is a permanent feature of the man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "I say, those chaps over there mean to kill us! What absolute rotters! Shall we have at them?"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has not hestitated to become personally involved in combat.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Running from battle will probably wipe away this general's reputation for bravery.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: An inspiration by example to his men, this general rightly has a reputation for bravery.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has "got stuck in" during close combat on more than one occasion.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Repeatedly running from battle will probably damage this general's reputation for bravery.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "I'm sure I have better things to do with my time in battle than worry about shot and balls!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has often crossed swords with the enemy on the field of battle.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Courage is now a permanent feature of this general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The reek of gunpowder, the clash of steel, the drum's tattoo: battle brings a knowing smile to this man's face!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has rarely missed an opportunity to cross swords with enemy forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Courage is now a permanent feature of this general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Foreigners and ladies grow pale in this man's presence, but for very different reasons.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general almost never misses an opportunity to cross swords with the enemy!
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Courage is now a permanent and inspiring feature of this general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A lack of physical courage is not necessarily a handicap to high command. No, really.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has routed at least once in the presence of the enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Victory in battle and personal combat will probably wipe away the suspicion of cowardice in this general.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general is scorned by his own officers, and even the other ranks smile when he - all too predictably - breaks wind before battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has repeatedly panicked in the presence of the enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Many victories will probably be required to wipe away the taint of cowardice in this general.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general's own trumpeting gives notice to the enemy of his fears, and all without troubling a bugler.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has persistently panicked when in the presence of an enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Cowardice is now a permanent feature of this general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Courage has become a stranger to this man. His people know it, and his lack of resolution fills them with contempt.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has very publicly and repeatedly panicked in the presence of an enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Cowardice is now a permanent feature of this general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has the ability to win, even when he has not chosen battle as a course of action.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been gained though victory in battle when the enemy has the initiative and is the attacker.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive skill may well be lost by defeat in battle while defending.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man shows a distinct talent for winning when the enemy apparently have the initiative.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of repeated and consistent success when defending against attacks by enemy armies.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive skill may well be lost by many defeats in battle while defending.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is an expert at letting the enemy come forward to their own doom!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of many great and glorious defensive successes in the field when the enemy initiated battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive ability is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: No attacker marches against this general with a light heart. His defensive skills are almost without equal.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of magnificent defensive successes in the field (not in sieges).
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive ability is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Even the great captains of the classical world would be challenged when attacking an army lead by this man.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of magnificent defensive victories in the field (not in sieges).
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive ability is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is unsure and slightly hesitant in defensive battles, and he rarely shows true quality.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of a few defeats at the hands of attacking enemy generals.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This flaw may be wiped away by a few victories when defending against enemy armies.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: When attacked, this man has a tendency to procrastinate, which does little to improve his performance as a general.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of consistently being defeated at the hands of attacking enemy generals.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This weakness will probably be wiped away by repeated victories when defending against enemy armies.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: When this man is defending, he shows few of the qualities expected of a war leader.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has been caused by many defeats on the battlefield when on the strategic defensive.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This general can never lose this tactical weakness in field defence.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "I find, sir, that a little gin is very calming on the nerves and steadies a man's hand."
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has been left with little to do, and boredom has been his downfall.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man needs orders that keep him occupied.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "I am drunk, Sir, and mark me well: I intend to horsewhip your tiny green servants."
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Repeatedly left with too little to do, this fellow has taken solace in the bottle.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: There is still a chance that sensible work can help this man recover his wits.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Claret. This man likes claret. Quite a lot of claret. All the claret. Everyone's claret. He has a strong bladder.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Ignored for too many years, this man has perfected drinking as a fine art.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unfortunate drunkeness is now a permanent stain on the man's character, and his undergarments.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Far gone in drink, this man rarely rises from the dinner table in order to relieve himself.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Too long ignored by his nation, this man has become a national disgrace.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will be washed into his grave by a river of gin. And claret. And small beer.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is a natural horseman, and fearless to boot.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: As a child, this man had only two toys: a sabre, and a hobby horse.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot change his dashing character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is the epitome of a dashing cavalry officer: madly brave, yet slightly less intelligent than his horse.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man learned to ride before he learned to walk.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot change his gallant ways and remain a true Frenchman.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has panache aplenty. His men would follow him to the Gates of Hell!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man's childhood was entirely given over to horses and sabres.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot lose his taste for the charge!

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a basic understanding of the arts of war.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of victory in battle, and can be improved by further victories.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if this general is defeated in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a good grasp of grand strategy and tactics.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of more than one victory and can be improved further.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost through repeated defeats in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is properly counted among the great captains in battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of repeated victories and can be improved further.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Men willingly march into Hell on this man's orders, sure that he will give them victory!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of several victories and can be improved further.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Great men stand - and ladies swoon - when this singular personification of military excellence enters a room!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has won many victories, and changed the fate of nations in the process.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has not come to terms with India or with war in India.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of losing a few battles in India.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be removed by winning a few victories in India.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The spicy food. The heat. The natives. The monsoon. The damn elephants! It's all quite, quite off-putting, don't you know!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of losing a good many battles in India.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait is now a permanent feature of this general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man shows a natural aptitude for warfare in the Indian style on Indian battlefields.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has come about as a result of winning battles in India.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if the general suffers a number of defeats in battle in India.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has fully grasped the subtleties of fighting in India, of making the best of the terrain, the climate - and the native warriors!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is a result of winning a great many battles in India.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This strategic benefit is permanent.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is held up for mockery in the press, even when he does things right!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has lost a major battle or two, unfortunately while public attention was upon him!
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This character stain can be removed through victory in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is mocked, mercilessly and ceaselessly, in pamphlets and newspapers.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has lost a few important battles - and lacks the wit to write self-congratulatory despatches!
character_trait_levels.removal_text: The hatred of the gutter press will be eased by victory in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man now twitches whenever the word "newspaper" is used within earshot.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has lost several major engagements, and is now blamed for much that is wrong in the army.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: No matter what battlefield success this man has, his reputation as a figure of fun will not change.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "Keep back, sir! Keep back! I will have none of your low-cut boots near me!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: The strain of campaigning has taken a toll upon this man's rationality.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A little less time to think, and a little more time in the thick of the action, will help this man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "There's always time for a jig. Or is that a pig? A wig? No. Figs: must keep your bowels open."
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Long years spent fighting abroad without proper rest have broken the mind of this once-rational man.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man needs to be kept on active service, so that he doesn't have time to brood.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "Terribly noisy: your marching. What say we hop into battle this time, and whistle like teapots?"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Too much time on campaign has made this fellow somewhat strange by the standards of his peers.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unfortunate quirk of character is now permanent.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A bellicose newt with a cutlass probably has more grasp of amphibious warfare than this man.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of failure when carrying out amphibious attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This flaw could well disappear if the general conducts a number of successful amphibious attacks.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man would possibly do better to drown himself rather than conduct attacks from the sea.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of failure when carrying out repeated amphibious attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait might be lost if the man carries out many successful amphibious attacks.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Perhaps this man harbours a morbid dread of fish and kelp; he certainly finds crossing a beach beyond his ken.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of many great and terrible failures when trying to conduct amphibious operations.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This failing is a permanent stain on this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has begun to master the tricky art of attacking from the sea.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of successfully carrying out amphibious attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait might be lost if the general loses when carrying out an amphibious attack.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a distinct aptitude for amphibious warfare, and is well able to lead his men ashore against an enemy.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait has resulted from successfully carrying out many amphibious attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait could be lost by repeatedly losing when leading an amphibious assault.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is a true sea-going warriorl, able to organise and execute attacks that take death and destruction to any enemy shore!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This exceptional talent has come about thanks to many successful amphibious attacks.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This useful trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "Drill! Drill! Drill! Constant drill is the way to win battles and move men, Sir!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has recruited many troops during his career.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may disappear as time mellows the man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The hatred of his men is something that this general relishes. It does not matter, as long as they march well!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has a long history of recruiting troops to the colours.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man's attitudes to discipline are set in stone, and will not change.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: While the men heartily dislike this man, his methods do make a hideous military sense.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Few men have as much experience in recruiting and training men for war.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man's iron will where discipline is concerned will never change.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Terrified by drunken Europeans as a child, this man has turned his fear into anger and hatred.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man's childhood marked him for life.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: No Mughal warrior would seek to change such opinions.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man entertains no doubts that his righteous fury against all things European is entirely proper.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Early experiences taught this man his duty.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A Mughal general will never change his opinion of the enemies of his blood.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is the sword and shield of his people, protecting them from any rapacious and foul European menace.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man cannot remember a time when he did not feel this way.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: As a tiger cannot stop hunting, so this man cannot change his unreasoning dislike.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Here is a man who knows when to shoot his load!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has been blessed with a victory or two while leading substantial artillery forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Defeat when leading a force with much artillery may remove this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Gunnery is more than an interest for this man. The crash of cannons lifts his very soul!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has been blessed with a few victories while leading substantial artillery forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Many defeats when leading a large number of artillery units may reduce this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general is a master of using the right tools for victory: guns, guns, guns and more guns.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has been blessed with many victories while leading substantial artillery forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has a love of the charge - and the sense not to use his cavalry indiscriminately!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has revelled in a victory or two while leading a substantial cavalry force.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Defeat while leading a large force of cavalry may remove this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has all the dash and fire one would expect of a gallant cavalryman!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has enjoyed several victories while leading a substantial cavalry force.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Many defeats while leading a large number of cavalry may reduce this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general is an expert horseman, a fine leader of men and a masterful cavalry tactician.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of a great many victories while commanding substantial cavalry forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has a natural aptitude for infantry combat and tactics.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has enjoyed victory when commanding an army almost exclusively of infantry forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Defeat while leading a force of infantry may remove this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has a splendid understanding of how to use infantry to the very best effect.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has enjoyed several victories when commanding an army almost exclusively of infantry forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Many defeats while leading a force of infantry may reduce this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is seen as a harsh taskmaster and is not loved - despite his habit of victory.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has enjoyed a great many victories when commanding an army almost exclusively of infantry forces.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man will give nothing to the enemies of Poland save, perhaps, hot lead and cold steel.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man is a true patriot. He was born that way. He will die that way.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Come what may, this man will remain Polish.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: There is iron to this man's soul, as harsh and unyielding as a Polish winter.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man cannot deny his blood or his birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man was born a Pole, and that is enough for him.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Every blade of grass is treated as though growing in the precious soil of Poland!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man's family history has marked him from birth.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will never deny his Polish roots.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man's every military act is reported on with approval!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Victory in a notable battle or two brings fame in its wake.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These good reports can soon be overturned by failure in battle.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The "free press" hardly ever print bad news or unkind comments about this general.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Repeated victory in major battles has brought this man to the attention of the newspapers.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Repeated failure in battle will damage this trait.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Editors fill their newspapers with laudatory commentaries upon this gentleman's many virtues.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has lead his troops to so many major victories that his triumphs cannot be easily counted.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: No matter how foolish or inept in battle, this man need not worry that the press will turn against him.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "It is fear, mein Herr, fear, that drives men forwards in battle, not the love of their officers!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was born a proud Prussian.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man is a born Junker, and cannot change this fact.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: "The men are scum, villains and thieves all, but we shall make them into an army to fear!"
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Fortune smiled on this man by making him a Prussian.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot disavow his Prussian birthright.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This officer is so fierce that the Devil himself would appoint him Captain of Hell's Legions!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This Prussian gentleman was born with a sword in his hand and a gleam in his eye.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man's character was set at birth, and cannot be changed.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is burdened by his love for his motherland, for he cannot do enough to be worthy as a Russian.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: From birth, this man has been burdened by his own desires to do more for the Motherland.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man will never lose his Russian spirit.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is determined to defend the motherland for all enemies, no matter what the cost.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has loved the Motherland since the moment he understood what it was to be Russian.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot change his soul, even if he wanted to do so.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has long been a stranger to fear - and sobriety - but, by Mother Russia, he can fight!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man's father instilled in him the true importance of being Russian.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Not even a Russian blizzard could change this man.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Having a feel for terrain is a distinct advantage whilst planning when and where to fight.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has moved fast and far, choosing his battlefields carefully.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Access to local knowledge and accurate mapmaking give this fellow an edge when deciding the particulars of battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has won many aggressive battles, thanks to his use of terrain.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability is now second nature for this man, and cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The shallower mysteries of siege warfare have so far eluded this man's understanding.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This is the result of failing in more than one siege.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost by successfully attacking at least one beseiged city or fort.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: A purblind fool is probably a better choice as a commander during a siege than this general.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of failing to bring many sieges to a successful conclusion.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait might be lost by successfully attacking many beseiged cities or forts.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man would make an excellent faggot to fill a moat or ditch or, perhaps, he could serve as a gabion.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This has been caused by a great many failures in carrying out sieges, over many years.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This weakness is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has a good, if elementary, understanding of siege warfare.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This skill has been gained by successfully carrying out sieges.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost by failing to complete sieges successfully.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has an expert's intuitive grasp of siege warfare and its intricacies.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This skill is the result of many successful sieges and assaults.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may well be lost by failing to complete many sieges.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has an ability to breach defences usually seen as impregnable. He is a master of siege warfare.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This skill is the end result of many great and glorious sieges, all carried to a victorious conclusion.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This beneficial trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This general has an exceptional aptitude for siege warfare, and is expected to carry any siege to a successful conclusion.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This skill is the end result of many great and glorious sieges, all carried to a victorious conclusion.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This beneficial trait is a permanent feature of this man's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Good, solid fortifications are not a useful feature of a battlefield for this man.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of failing to hold back at least one attack on defended fortifications.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait will probably disappear if the general successfully defends when besieged on a few occasions.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is stunningly inept where fortifications are concerned.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of failing - on many occasions - to defend a fortification when attacked.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait could be lessened if the general successfully defends cities and forts.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: For this man, walls are merely useful structures on which to grow roses.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of repeated and persistent failures when defending fortified positions in battle.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive ineptitude is a permanent fixture of the general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man understands the basics of fighting from prepared defences. Any attacker will learn this the hard way!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of successfully defending at least one city or fort.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait may be lost if the general is defeated when defending a few cities or forts.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is fully able to make the best of any defensive works to hold on at whatever cost.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of successfully defending many cities or forts.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This trait could well be lost if the general fails to defend many cities or forts.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Give this man ramparts, counter-scarps and ravelins to defend, and he will hold until Death claims him!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of successfully defending a great many cities or forts.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive mastery is a permanent feature of the general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man can make a heap of rubble defensible, and could hold a wall against the Devil himself!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This trait is the result of successfully defending a great many cities or forts.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This defensive mastery is a permanent feature of the general's character.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This General shows much consideration - possibly too much - to the lower ranks.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This general has not been particularly active in military matters.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A taste of battle will crush any inappropriate kindness in this general's soul.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has little taste for the harsh realities of army discipline, and winks an eye at most offences.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Over many years, this general has not pushed his men to their limits.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: A few battles may teach this general that the good opinion of his men matters less than their survival.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Discipline in this man's command is a disgrace to the entire army in the opinion of his officers.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man has a long history of not being terribly active when on campaign.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man's unfortunate habit of kindness to underlings is too ingrained to change now.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man is blessed with a fighting spirit, worthy of his pagan Viking forefathers.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was born tempered for war.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This man cannot change his nature, nor would he even want to do so.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Some would call this man mad, driven to distraction by the long winter nights of his home. But the truth is simple: he enjoys battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man did not have a rattle as a baby, but a tiny sabre!
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Why change? In battle, a man can measure his capacities.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Battle makes this man's blood sing. Only with the smell of blood in his nostrils does he feel truly alive or awake.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This man was born to fight, and to be bored at all other times.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This aggressive nature cannot be tamed or mitigated.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This man has a natural aptitude for the business of gunnery.
