character_trait_levels.removal_text: This text should not be translated.

character_trait_levels.onscreen_name: Region is a yellow fever source
character_trait_levels.colour_text: This text should not be translated.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This text should not be translated.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This text should not be translated.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The plagues and sicknesses of America hold no threat for these men.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Thanks to time in America, these men have had chance to get sick and recover from local infirmities.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These men will never lose their immunity to the diseases of the Americas.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This unit has been exposed to the disease and filth of Europe.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Having spent time in Europe, these men no longer need fear the locally prevalent sicknesses.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These men will never lose their immunity to the diseases of Europe.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The terrible plagues of India are unlikely to harm these men.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have spent enough time in India to have built up a resistance to its diseases.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These men will never lose their immunity to the diseases of India.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This unit is unlikely to fall sick in the harsh conditions of the Middle East.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have spent enough time in the area to know how to avoid getting ill.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These men will never lose their immunity to the diseases of the Middle East.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men have learned the value of surprise, concealment, ambush and all-round sneakiness!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have fought many times in the Americas, and have learned from the experience.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This skill cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This unit has taken all that the tribes can offer and made those skills its own.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have learned excellent fieldcraft in their many battles.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These combat skills are part of the unit's spirit.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: View halloo! Is there anything more stirring than the charge?
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This unit has broken at least one enemy unit with a charge.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unit will not lose its love of the charge.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The thunder of hooves! The majesty of a charge! These men live for little else - save glory!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have repeatedly, and successfully, charged the enemy.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unit cannot lose this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Fighting is a nasty business, so it pays to be better than the next man.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have broken at least one enemy unit in close combat.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unit will never lose this reputation, only enhance it.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Killing men takes practice, and practice makes perfect.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This unit has broken enemy units in close combat on many occasions.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This reputation has been hard won, and will never be surrendered.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This unit has learned that European ways may be odd, but they are effective.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have fought in Europe many times, and learned much by doing so.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: The unit will always retain this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men have adopted much that is European, at least where fighting is concerned.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have learned much by long and hard fighting against Europeans.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These men will always fight this well.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men are becoming "old hands" in India and at Indian warfare.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Indian tactics, seen in battle, are beginning to "rub off" on these men.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: The unit cannot lose this hard-won expertise.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Few men joke about this unit's quaint native ways; they look on in awe when it fights!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This unit has almost "gone native" in its style of fighting.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This tactical expertise cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men have been laid low by continuous, explosive and repulsive diarrhea.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: The smell of infection is enough to pass on this disease, as everyone knows.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Time and bed rest will aid the sufferers in making a recovery.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The sick are racked by headaches and aching muscles, making their duties absolute torture.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: The air these men have been breathing is obviously fetid and diseased.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Time will restore the unit's collective health.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The men of this unit have become adept at digging new latrines.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Too long in the unsanitary conditions of camp has, inevitably, caused this problem.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unpleasant condition must run its course.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men are racked by fevers and illness, and cannot be expected to soldier on.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This malady is so widespread that it can only be a malign astrological influence at work.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Time will restore the unit's health.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men are suffering from swamp fever, or ague. It makes their existence a living hell.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: The rank air that these men have been in has caused this horrible fever.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: For reasons unknown, the sufferers never really recover from the ague.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men are suffering from the "little plague": small comfort to the sufferers in the ranks.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: The "red menace" strikes as it will, laying men low for a time.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unit will recover, given time and rest.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Perhaps the number of dead rats in the area should have been a warning of the terror that has been unleashed.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: The men of this unit have the plague.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Men live or die according to the whims of cruel Fate when the plague walks among them.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Sickly and barely able to do their duties, these men undoubtedly have scurvy.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have spent too long at sea.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Time in port will help these men recover.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The few healthy men in this unit await the appearance of their own smallpox pustules.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Smallpox strikes as it will. It is a curse from God.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Rest and medical attention will restore the survivors' health.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The men of this unit are subject to terrible coughing fits.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have obviously lived in an environment of hideous stenches and smells.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: There is no cure for this unfortunate condition.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Typhus has laid these men low. They cannot function as soldiers.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Soldiers in close contact with each other in unsalubirous conditions fall ill. What more is there to say?
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Time and medical attention may affect a cure.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: The sick men of this unit are jaundiced, and struck down by attacks of vomiting black blood.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have been near to sufferers of yellow fever.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Those the yellow fever does not kill will recover.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These warriors are protected by powerful magics, amulets, and signs. They cannot be harmed in battle.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These talismans are granted to the unit when it is created.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men are experts at moving heavy cannon across country.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Long years on campaign have taught these men much.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: Good habits, once instilled, tend to be kept.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men can take an artillery piece to places that even a mountain goat would find difficult!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: These men have years of experience.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unit cannot lose this useful skill.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men have a bloody and deserved reputation for breaking heads and restoring order.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This unit has put down at least one rebellion.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This reputation for cruelty cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: Law and order are watchwords to these men, except where their own conduct is concerned.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: This unit has been involved in suppressing many rebellions.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This attitude cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men have a remarkable record of accurate shooting.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Battle teaches harsh lessons to the survivors.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: These men are unlikely to forget how to shoot!

character_trait_levels.colour_text: These men can shoot a mouse in the eye at a hundred paces - or so they claim!
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Survive many battles, and you learn what is truly important.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This unit cannot lose this sharpshooting ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This crew is rather skilled in taking enemy ships.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Carrying out successful boarding actions has given this crew some skill.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This crew cannot lose this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This crew has a collective talent for mayhem, especially when boarding an enemy.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Repeatedly boarding enemy ships has given this crew a knack for the task.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: The crew will never lose this ability.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: An enemy boarding party can be sure of a hot welcome from this crew.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Beating off attacks by enemy boarders has given this crew some skill.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This ability cannot be lost by this crew.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This crew has an arrangement with sharks: they defeat any boarders, and the fish clean up the mess.
character_trait_levels.explanation_text: Defeating many attacks by enemy boarders has given this a taste for close combat.
character_trait_levels.removal_text: This exceptional ability cannot be lost.

character_trait_levels.colour_text: This war chief is unsure about attacking tactics.
This man is a weak leader when attacking the enemy.
Attacking an enemy is one aspect of warfare that this chief cannot understand.
This war chief is known to be at his best when leading an attack.
This man is known to be aggressive in battle, and have terror in his eye.
This chief is an extremely aggressive and skilful leader when ordering an attack.
Few war chiefs can match this man's skills when sending men into the attack.
This man is a master of attacking warfare. His warriors would follow him anywhere.
This chief thinks he understands the business of war. He does not.
Command of warriors in battle is not a skill owned by this man.
This man is not fit to give orders to the lowliest dog, let alone a warrior.
This man is truly dangerous, mostly to his own unfortunate warriors.
Few war chiefs attain such incompetence and live long in battle.
This war chief does not let casualties in battle worry him.
If a victory is gained, what does it matter if warriors fall in battle?
A victory cannot be counted as such unless the battlefield is soaked in blood.
Warfare is this man's calling. His voice is the cry of the wolf!
This man was born to fight, as his enemies soon discover!
This man was born with a tomahawk clutched in his infant fist.
"I will face my enemies, and they will see that I do not fear them."
This chief rightly has a reputation for bravery.
This man must have the heart of a bear for all the fear he shows.
This chief casts a hero's shadow when he walks.
The tribe is blessed by the Spirits to have such a great-hearted warrior.
This man has the air of an eagle: watchful and ready to strike at any weakness.
This man has been a leader since he was a fledgling brother to an eagle, or so his people claim.
This man is his father's son, with a look of command and a fierce eye.
A leader does not need to put himself in danger to prove his worth.
This chief is scorned by his warriors, mostly because of his smell before battle.
Does a chief who is thought a coward deserve to be a chief?
Courage is a stranger to this man. His people know it. He knows it, and yet he can do nothing about it.
When on the defensive in battle, this man seldom performs well.
When fighting a defensive battle, this man's poor skills put his warriors at risk.
When this man is defending, he shows none of the qualities needed in a chief.
This chief can win, even when he is forced to do battle.
This man can turn the enemy's attacks back on them, more often than not.
This man refuses to give ground, and lets the enemy defeat themselves!
No foes attack this man with hope in their hearts. He will not yield!
Even the greatest heroes would think twice before taking a fight to this man.
This man understands war. He does not like it, but he knows what he is doing.
This man's thoughts turn easily to the enemy's ruin.
This man is counted among the great chieftains of war.
Few warriors dare stand against such a fighter.
Warriors willingly follow this man into the bear's jaws, and smile as they do so.
This man suspects the motives of white men in all their dealings.
The foreigners oppress and exploit! They deserve no mercy!
The Europeans have trampled on sacred lands and offended the Spirits! They must be driven out!
Now comes peace. For now, this man does not walk a path of war.
This man was born with a bear's claw in his hand. He has the bear's strength in his heart.
This man is a brother to bears, and can match their strength with his own.
Sired by a bear, or so his mother claims, this man is as savage as a bear to the tribe's foes.
This man was born with all the cunning of a wolf, in hunting and in war.
This man can count the wolves as brothers, and has learned much from their harsh ways.
This man might as well have been fathered by a wolf, for his cunning and cruelty to enemies have no limits.
This man is gently mocked, usually behind his back, by the women of the tribe.
Many a tale is told around the campfires about this man and his stupidities.
This man now stays in his lodge, and listens to the cruel laughter from around the campfire.
"Baaaa-aaaah!"
"I have seen the glittering knives of the moon people. They will come for our enemies! Soon, yes, soon!"
"The owls are not what they seem."
This man knows how to use cavalry in war.
This man has the pride, courage and strengh of a stallion. He can use all of those in war.
This man understands the use horses in war so well that some believe he is part horse himself!
This man was born in the saddle, and the open plains are his inheritance.
Nursed by a buffalo, this man has their strength and endurance in all things.
This man can count the buffalo among his ancestors, and has the buffalo's power at his command.
Battle is the place to test your courage, not your skill in killing.
Personal glory is at least as important as victory.
War is a game, and counting coup on the enemy is the only worthwhile way of playing!
This man is a hero of many a campfire anecdote.
When the children need a tale of bravery to send them to sleep, this man's name is always mentioned.
This man is a true hero to his people, and his deeds will be the stuff of legends in days to come.
This man was born in the saddle, and a lance was his first plaything.
This man was nursed by a mare, and he has her wisdom in his heart.
This man has the strength and power of a mighty stallion. No rider is his equal.
The mysteries of assaulting a wall remain mysterious to this man.
This man should not be allowed to lead warriors in a siege. Ever.
Walls hold some peculiar terror for this chief. This explains his uselessness when conducting a siege.
This chief has an elementary understanding of siege warfare.
This chief has an intuitive grasp of siege warfare and its intricacies.
This chief has an ability to breach defences usually seen as impregnable.
This chief has an exceptional aptitude for siege warfare, and will break most defences.
Good, solid fortifications are pointless to this chief.
This man cannot be trusted to hold any fortification.
This man hates being confined within walls, and cannot make use of them as a result.
This chief understands the basics of prepared defences, as any attacker will quickly learn!
This chief makes the best of any defensive works.
Give this chief a wall to defend, and he will hold until death takes him!
This chief could make rubble defensible, and could hold a wall against the white man's Devil himself!
This man has taken Catholic Christian communion.
This man is devoutly Catholic, to the exclusion of much else in his life.
This man has a mind like a tomahawk's edge.
This man can thrust his thoughts into the heart of any problem.
Sometimes it is truly wise not to make other warriors feel like slack-jawed fools.
This man has gone against his word. Now he is plagued by visions of the Flying Head.
Betrayal of his allies has led to dogged pursuit by the Flying Head.
The Flying Head has pursued this man into madness, and beyond!
A joke in poor taste between warriors is one thing, but this man is something else!
This man's behaviour is an embarrassment to the tribe, let alone the women he approaches.
This man's appalling behaviour would shame a European colonist, even a Frenchman.
This man is crippled by a foul afflction, brought on by his own uncontrolled lusts.
This man is somewhat slow on the uptake, but he eventually understands most things.
This man does not trouble himself with thinking too often.
There really are piles of dung with more grasp of the world than this man.
"I like pans. Do you like pans?"
This man shows a marked preference for Europeans, much to the annoyance of the Spirits.
His lodge is stuffed with European furniture and, it is rumoured, European gold.
"I will have obedience, or there will be blood. What more is there to say?"
"For the good of the tribe, I must have obedience in all things."
"No man who obeys my word need fear. The stubborn should kiss their wives goodbye."
This man has been converted to the Hindu faith.
This man lives only to perfect his soul, according to Hindu rites.
Born with the eye of a wolf, this man merely follows his natural inclinations.
An interest in hunting precludes much interest in the tribe's welfare.
Is there anything else worth doing in life? Exactly. Of course not.
This man has renounced all gods save for Allah, the Merciful.
This man has renounced all gods save for Allah, the Merciful.
"Fear not, my brothers, for the lost tribes of the moon will bring deliverance!"
"Bring me frogs! Blue frogs! Not pink frogs. I like frogs, and potatoes!"
The great chief is unwell. Perhaps it is something he ate. Or something that is eating him, very slowlyâ€¦
This man has adopted the Orthodox Christian faith.
This man's faith has been bolstered by the many icons in his possession.
There is no shame in wanting peace. There is great honour in making peace.
Only a fool chooses war instead of peace. This man is not a fool.
There is iron in this man's words, and therefore there is iron in his promise of peace.
The Spirits taunt this man, snatching success away from him.
The Spirits show no mercy to this man, and spite his every endeavour.
This man is plagued by visitations, ill-luck and his own fears. He has done much to deserve this fate.
This man has been accepted into the Protestant Church.
This man has been profoundly convinced by the truth of the Protestant Christian faith.
This man is a great advocate for settled farming as a way of life for the tribe.
This man believes that the tribe's wealth is entirely dependent upon their farmlands.
This man does not have the skills for battle, but he fully supports those who do.
This man knows that battle is not the only measure of a tribe's strength. War is more than battle.
This man is obsessive in his support for the tribe's warriors. Some of them find him a little disturbing.
This man believes that making things cannot be left only to women and the old. The tribe must be rich.
This man has seen European machines, and wants his tribe to have the same.
This man believes passionately that his tribe must match the Europeans in machinery, as well as war.
Trade between tribes and nations can only be for the common good of our people.
This man would trade his own grandmother and sister if it would profit the tribe. Perhaps he has already done so.
This man has a talent for leading others astray.
This man's words could persuade a snake to slither willingly into a campfire.
This man kills for his tribe, without hesitation and without losing any sleep.
This man will kill for his tribe, but also because he has come to enjoy it.
This man kills, kills again, and will keep on killing as long as his tribe has enemies.
Foxes come to this man for lessons in being sneaky.
This man can lie to weasel Spirits, and they do not notice.
When a fox lacks a plan, he plots with another one. This man has a family of foxes, living in his head.
This man has a talent for breaking things, particularly when they belong to his enemies.
This man can destroy almost anything: he is a storm in the shape of a man.
This man has spoken with the Spirits of the earth.
He has ridden the winds, communing with the Spirits.
The Spirits have shown this man how to walk in the land of dreams.
All life comes from the Spirits, and this man honours them.
This man listens to the Spirits, and will act on their orders when he must.
The Spirits favour this man, and listen kindly to his requests.
When this man speaks, the tribes listen to his voice.
When this man speaks, the tribes listen to his voice.
The Dance opens the way to the Spirit world, and all else follows.
The Spirits move this man, and give him the strength to do much that others think impossible.
This man has not seen much warfare, yet he has thought much upon it.
This man has done much thinking about his tribe and its wars, and understands much.
This man has talked to many old warriors, and learned much about the path to war.
This man has thought deeply, and talked with the Spirits. Nothing in war is a mystery to him.
